result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
with Exhibit #1 attached.

3:27 PM (64-06) Defendant Marquee D Haynes appeared in court, Attorney Leah Selmek appeared in court for Marquee D Haynes, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin, Vivian TenHaken appeared in court. 
State called to the stand as a witness, Sgt. Robert Rayfield.
Sgt. Robert Rayfield duly sworn and testified on direct examination by ADA TenHaken.
Witness identified defendant in court.
Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed. Exhibit #1 offered and received.
3:29 PM - Cross examination by Attorney Selmek.
Evidence is closed.
3:33 PM - Argument by ADA TenHaken.
Argument by Attorney Selmek.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him/her over to stand trial on the charges. 
Attorney Selmek acknowledges the Information, waived reading plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of her client.
Court's response to State's motion to modify Bond - "Ok to amend the bond adding the no contact if the defendant does not object by February 17." PAK
State's Motion to Modify Bond

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Leah Selmek
Signed bond filed with the court.

AMENDMENT 3/4/2022: ADDED CONDITION-Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH M.M.W. date of birth 9/13/1981.

BOND COVERS 22CF74, 22CF71 & 21CF635
CASH ALREADY POSTED  
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Marquee D Haynes in court with attorney Mackenzie Renner for Attorney Leah Selmek.  Samuel Thomas Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case filed before lunch.  Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made.  Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Rights given and hearing requested, time period waived. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
